bib.title: Multitemporal analysis of high-spatial-resolution optical satellite imagery for mangrove species mapping in Bali, Indonesia
bib.citation: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote …, 2016
bib.author: Gaëlle Viennois and Christophe Proisy and Jean-Baptiste Feret and Juliana Prosperi and Frida Sidik and Rinny Rahmania and Nicolas Longépé and Olivier Germain and Philippe Gaspar
bib.journal: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing
bib.abstract: Mapping zonations of mangrove species (ZMS) is important when assessing the functioning of such specific ecosystems. However, the reproducibility of remote sensing methods for discriminating and mapping mangrove habitats is often overstated due to the lack of temporal observations. Here, we investigated the potential use of temporal series of high-resolution multispectral satellite images to discriminate and map four typical Asian ZMS. This study was based on the analysis of eight images acquired between 2001 and 2014 over the mangrove area of Nusa Lembongan, Bali, Indonesia. Variations between years in the top-of-atmosphere reflectance signatures were examined as functions of the acquisition angles. We also applied maximum likelihood supervised classification to all of the images and determined the variability in the classification errors.
